title: How to Remove Tag in Instagram: Posts, Mentions, Comments

steps.title: Navigate to the post you're tagged in.
steps.content: Navigate to the post you're tagged in. If someone tagged you in a photo or video post and you'd rather not be tagged, you can easily untag yourself. Currently, you can't remove tags on the Instagram website. It's not possible to untag yourself from a comment on someone else's post, but you can prevent being tagged by changing your privacy settings. You can also send a direct message to the person who created the post and ask them to delete the comment, or report the comment as a violation of Instagram's policies.

steps.title: Tap your username on the post.
steps.content: Tap your username on the post. If you don't see it, tap the photo or video once to bring it up.

steps.title: Tap Remove me from post.
steps.content: Tap Remove me from post . This will remove your tag. Alternatively, you can select Hide from my profile to remove it from view. According to Davis, "the photo will not show up on your Instagram profile under tagged photos, but you will still be tagged."

steps.title: Tap Remove.
steps.content: Tap Remove . This will remove the tag. Keep in mind the post will stay up unless the original poster deletes it.

steps.title: Tap your profile icon.
steps.content: Tap your profile icon. If you aren't already logged into your Instagram account, do so now. This method can be used to remove multiple tags at once. It's not possible to untag yourself from a comment on someone else's post, but you can prevent being tagged by changing your privacy settings. You can also send a direct message to the person who created the post and ask them to delete the comment , or report the comment as a violation of Instagram's policies.

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . This is at the top-right corner.

steps.title: Tap Your activity.
steps.content: Tap Your activity . This will be below the How you use Instagram header.

steps.title: Tap Tags.
steps.content: Tap Tags . This is the third option under the Interactions header.

steps.title: Tap Select.
steps.content: Tap Select . You'll now see a little circle at the corner of each post.

steps.title: Select the posts.
steps.content: Select the posts. Once selected, you'll see a small checkmark at the bottom-right corner of the post.

steps.title: Tap Remove.
steps.content: Tap Remove . You can find this at the bottom.

steps.title: Tap Remove.
steps.content: Tap Remove . The tags will be removed from all selected posts.

steps.title: Go to the post you want to edit.
steps.content: Go to the post you want to edit. If you want to remove or change a tag you've added to one of your own photo or video posts, you can easily do so by editing the post. It's not possible to edit Stories once you've posted them.

steps.title: Tap the three dots at the post's top-right corner.
steps.content: Tap the three dots at the post's top-right corner. A menu will expand.

steps.title: Tap Edit.
steps.content: Tap Edit . You'll see this on the menu. If you want to remove a tag for a product, tap Tag Products to bring up product-specific tags now. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the Tag icon.
steps.content: Tap the Tag icon. It's the outline of a person at the bottom-left corner of the photo or video.

steps.title: Tap the tag you want to remove.
steps.content: Tap the tag you want to remove. An X will appear on the tag.

steps.title: Tap the X on the tag.
steps.content: Tap the X on the tag. This removes the tag from the photo. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the checkmark (Android) or Done (iPhone/iPad).
steps.content: Tap the checkmark (Android) or Done (iPhone/iPad). This removes the tag from the post. If the post contains multiple photos or videos, you can swipe through the photos or videos and remove other tags as needed.

steps.title: Tap the checkmark (Android) or Done (iPhone/iPad) again.
steps.content: Tap the checkmark (Android) or Done (iPhone/iPad) again. This saves your changes to the post. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Find the comment you are tagged in.
steps.content: Find the comment you are tagged in. Although you can't untag yourself from a comment someone left on another person's post, you have some options for removing the mention.

steps.title: Report the comment (optional).
steps.content: Report the comment (optional). If the comment that contains your username violates your privacy or Instagram's terms of service, swipe left on the comment, tap the icon of a chat bubble with an exclamation point (!) inside, and then tap Report this comment . [4] X Research source You'll be asked to specify why the comment you're reporting is in violation. If Instagram decides the comment violates their policies, they'll remove it from the post.

steps.title: Send a message to the person who created the post.
steps.content: Send a message to the person who created the post. Whether it was that person who mentioned you in a comment or someone else who follows their posts, you can always send a message to the post creator to ask that they delete the offending comment. To send a message, tap the username at the top of the post, tap Message , and then send your message. Be kind in your request, and you'll have a better shot at getting the comment removed.

steps.title: Tap the profile photo at the bottom-right corner of Instagram.
steps.content: Tap the profile photo at the bottom-right corner of Instagram. If you don't want people to be able to tag you in photos and videos, and/or mention your username in comments, you can make some quick changes to your privacy settings. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . It's at the top-right corner.

steps.title: Tap Tags and mentions.
steps.content: Tap Tags and mentions . This is under the How others can interact with you header.

steps.title: Select Don't allow tags.
steps.content: Select Don't allow tags . This is in the first section. Alternatively, you can toggle on Manually approve tags if you don't want to disable it entirely. You can also disable mentions by selecting Don't allow mentions .
